required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Evaluation of the Linox Family ICD Leads Registry (GALAXY)
clinical_study.official_title: GALAXY Registry: Long-term Evaluation of the Linox Family ICD Leads Registry

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to confirm the long-term safety and reliability of the Linox Lead System as used with BIOTRONIK ICDs. The GALAXY registry will provide data to fully characterize ICD lead failures, from implant through 5 years, including those failures contributing to patients losing pacing or defibrillation therapy.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is a multi-center, prospective, non-randomized, 5-year data collection registry. Eligible patients must have been successfully implanted with a Linox Lead System connected to a BIOTRONIK ICD and consented and enrolled between 1-45 days following implant. This study is designed to be a post-implant (office-based) registry, and patients are meant to be seen according to each institution's standard of care, but not to exceed a follow-up time frame of every 6 months. At least 2000 patients will be enrolled in this registry, and each patient will be followed for five years post-implant.
Safety will be evaluated based on the analysis of the overall incidence of lead-related adverse events that require additional invasive intervention to resolve. In addition, each individual adverse event will be separately investigated. Lead parameters for sensing, pacing thresholds, and impedance will also be evaluated. An independent Clinical Events Committee will review and adjudicate all adverse events that occur during the study according to the protocol definitions.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Who Are Free of Complications Related to the Linox ICD Lead
primary_outcome.description: The overall incidence of complications (serious adverse events that require additional invasive intervention to resolve or specific non-invasive actions) related to the Linox ICD leads implanted with a market-released BIOTRONIK ICD device was evaluated. This was evaluated as a serious adverse event free-rate (SAEFR).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Experienced Primary Outcome 1 Complication(s) Per Individual Complication Type
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the individual types of serious adverse events (SAEs) contributing to primary outcome 1 and their associated SAE category.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Experienced Serious Adverse Event(s) Excluded From Primary Outcome 1 (ICD, Device, and Implant Procedure Related) Through 5 Years Post-Implant.
Number of Subjects Who Experienced Serious Adverse Event(s) Excluded From Primary Outcome 1 (RA Lead Related) Through 5 Years Post-Implant.
Pacing Threshold Measurements for the Linox Lead System at Scheduled GALAXY Registry Follow-ups Through 5 Years Post-implant.
secondary_outcome.description: Pacing thresholds performed at 0.5 ms pulse-width were requested. Threshold data reported below was collected at 0.5 ms pulse-width. The mean pacing threshold is calculated as a mean across all study visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensing Measurements for the Linox Lead System at Scheduled GALAXY Registry Follow-ups Through 5 Years Post-implant.
secondary_outcome.description: The mean sensing measurement is calculated as a mean across all study visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pacing Impedance Measurements for the Linox Lead System at Scheduled GALAXY Registry Follow-ups Through 5 Years Post-implant.
secondary_outcome.description: The mean pacing impedance measurement is calculated as a mean across all study visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Individual Electrical Parameters (Pacing Threshold) of Each Linox Lead System Model.
secondary_outcome.description: Pacing thresholds performed at 0.5 ms pulse-width were requested. Threshold data reported below was collected at 0.5 ms pulse-width. The mean pacing threshold of each Linox Lead System model was calculated as a mean across all study visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Individual Electrical Parameters (Sensing) of Each Linox Lead System Model.
secondary_outcome.description: The mean sensing measurements of each Linox Lead System model were calculated as a mean across all study visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Individual Electrical Parameters (Pacing Impedance) of Each Linox Lead System Model.
secondary_outcome.description: The mean pacing impedance of each Linox Lead System model was calculated as a mean across all study visits.

intervention.description: Collecting long-term safety and efficacy data on a family of market-released ICD leads.

study_pop.textblock: Patients will be obtained from the investigators' general patient population according to the inclusion and exclusion criteria described below.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Successfully implanted Linox Lead System connected to a BIOTRONIK ICD, from 1-45 days prior to enrollment
- Able to understand the nature of the registry and provide informed consent
- Available for follow-up visits on a regular basis at the investigational site
- Age greater than or equal to 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Enrolled in any IDE clinical study
- Planned cardiac surgical procedures or investigational measures within the next 6 months
- Expected to receive a heart transplant within 1 year
- Life expectancy less than 1 year
- Presence of another life-threatening, underlying illness separate from their cardiac disorder
- Pregnancy
- Inability to provide date of implant, devices implanted, age, gender, and whether the patient experienced any protocol-defined adverse events since implant

clinical_study.keyword: Long-term safety and reliability of ICD leads

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects Who Are Free of Complications Related to the Linox ICD Lead
outcome.description: The overall incidence of complications (serious adverse events that require additional invasive intervention to resolve or specific non-invasive actions) related to the Linox ICD leads implanted with a market-released BIOTRONIK ICD device was evaluated. This was evaluated as a serious adverse event free-rate (SAEFR).
outcome.population: The evaluable subject population is the sum of the total unique subjects who completed the 5-year follow-up and/or who experienced a primary endpoint adverse event.

group.title: Data Collection Group

measure.title: Percentage of Subjects Who Are Free of Complications Related to the Linox ICD Lead
measure.description: The overall incidence of complications (serious adverse events that require additional invasive intervention to resolve or specific non-invasive actions) related to the Linox ICD leads implanted with a market-released BIOTRONIK ICD device was evaluated. This was evaluated as a serious adverse event free-rate (SAEFR).
measure.population: The evaluable subject population is the sum of the total unique subjects who completed the 5-year follow-up and/or who experienced a primary endpoint adverse event.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Estimated SAEFR at 5 years is 92.5% with a 5% non-inferiority margin (87.5%). Type I error (alpha) is 0.05 (one-sided for non-inferiority). Statistical power is 80%.

outcome.title: Pacing Threshold Measurements for the Linox Lead System at Scheduled GALAXY Registry Follow-ups Through 5 Years Post-implant.
outcome.description: Pacing thresholds performed at 0.5 ms pulse-width were requested. Threshold data reported below was collected at 0.5 ms pulse-width. The mean pacing threshold is calculated as a mean across all study visits.
outcome.population: 17 subjects were excluded due to incomplete data.

reported_events.time_frame: Implant to Study Exit (up to 5 years)

group.title: Data Collection Group
group.description: ICD Therapy - ICD Lead Registry: Collecting long-term safety and efficacy data on a family of market-released ICD leads.

event.sub_title: ICD lead dislodgement (occuring <= 180 days post-implant procedure)
ICD lead high pacing threshold, intermittent capture, no lead capture
ICD lead related cardiac perforation with or without tamponade
ICD lead impedance out of range, low impedance, potential insulation break
ICD lead impedance out of range, high impedance, potential conductor fracture
Other ICD lead related: lead noise or oversensing
ICD lead dislodgement (occuring > 180 days post-implant procedure)
ICD lead undersensing or loss of sensing
ICD lead inability to defibrillate or pace
Other ICD lead related: no slack in the lead due to probable dislodgement
Other ICD lead related: noise consistent with probable fracture
Other ICD lead related: tension pneumothorax
Premature battery depletion, warranting device replacement
RA lead impedance out of range, high impedance, potential conductor fracture
RA lead undersensing or loss of sensing
RA lead high pacing threshold, intermittent capture, no lead capture
Thrombus attached to ICD lead (unrelated to ICD lead)
Infection not due to secondary infection
ICD lead high pacing threshold, intermittent capture, no lead capture
ICD lead impedance out of range, high impedance, potential conductor fracture
RA lead impedance out of range, high impedance, potential conductor fracture
Infection not due to secondary infection

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Principal Investigators agree to submit copies of any manuscript proposed for publication to Sponsor for review at least 30 days in advance of submission for publication or presentation. Sponsor may extend such review period for another 90 days to file patent applications or take other steps to protect its intellectual property interests, or to remove from the paper or presentation any language that is detrimental to Sponsor's intellectual property interests
